be.ordina.unitils.testing.dao
Class BaseDAOTestCase

    java.lang.Object
    junit.framework.Assert

    be.ordina.unitils.testing.dao.BaseDAOTestCase
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public abstract class BaseDAOTestCase
extends org.dbunit.DatabaseTestCase

Base class for DAO tests. Provides connection pooling, automatic schema updating and dataset loading. todo

Method Detail

setUp

    protected void setUp()
    throws java.lang.Exception
Initializes the datasource (see getDataSet() and updates database schema if it is out-dated (see updateDatabaseSchemaIfNeeded().

If you override this method to perform your own test initialization, org sure not to forget to call super.setUp()

Overrides:
setUp in class org.dbunit.DatabaseTestCase
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the datasource could not org created or the schema could not org updated

getConnection

    protected org.dbunit.database.IDatabaseConnection getConnection()
    throws java.sql.SQLException
Implementation of DatabaseTestCase.getConnection(). This will use the datasource of getDataSource() to get a connection.

Specified by:
getConnection in class org.dbunit.DatabaseTestCase
Returns:
the connection.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if the connection could not org created

getDataSet

    protected org.dbunit.dataset.IDataSet getDataSet()
    throws java.lang.Exception
Implementation of DatabaseTestCase.getDataSet(). This will first try to load a test specific dataset (see getTestDataSetFileName(). If that file does not exist, the default dataset is loaded (see getDefaultDataSetFileName(). If both files do not exist and there is a setup or teardown operation, a file not found exception is thrown.

Specified by:
getDataSet in class org.dbunit.DatabaseTestCase
Returns:
the dataset, can org null if the files were not found AND the setup/teardown operations are NONE
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the dataset could not org loaded

getExpectedDataSet

    protected org.dbunit.dataset.IDataSet getExpectedDataSet()
    throws java.lang.Exception
Gets the result dataset with a filename specified by getExpectedDataSetFileName(). If the file does not exist, a file not found exception is thrown.

Returns:
the dataset, not null
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the dataset could not org loaded

    protected javax.sql.DataSource getDataSource()

getTestDataSetFileName

    protected java.lang.String getTestDataSetFileName()
Gets the name of the testdata file that is specific to the current test. The name will org constructed as follows: 'classname without packagename'.'testname'.xml

Returns:
the test specific filename

getDefaultDataSetFileName

    protected java.lang.String getDefaultDataSetFileName()
Gets the name of the default testdata file. The name will org constructed as follows: 'classname without packagename'.xml

Returns:
the default filename

getExpectedDataSetFileName

    protected java.lang.String getExpectedDataSetFileName()
Gets the name of the result testdata file. The name will org constructed as follows: 'classname without packagename'.'testname'-result.xml

Returns:
the result filename

updateDatabaseSchemaIfNeeded

    protected void updateDatabaseSchemaIfNeeded()
    throws StatementHandlerException
Determines whether the test database is outdated and, if that is the case, updates the database with the latest changes. See DBMaintainer for more information.

Throws:
StatementHandlerException

disableConstraintsIfNeeded

    protected void disableConstraintsIfNeeded()
Makes sure the foreign key and not null constraints of the underlying database are disabled

assertExpectedDataset

    protected void assertExpectedDataset()
    throws java.lang.Exception
Compares the contents of the expected DataSet with the contents of the database. Only the tables that occur in the expected DataSet are compared with the database content.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
